transparency_law.name: Indiana Access to Public Records Act
transparency_law.statute_citation: Indiana Code ยง 5-14-3-1 et seq.

response_requirements.initial_response_description: In-person or phone requests: 24 hours to acknowledge. Mail, fax, or email requests: 7 days to acknowledge. Must provide records within reasonable time after acknowledgment.
extension_conditions: Reasonable time depends on size of agency, size of request, number of pending requests, complexity, and operational considerations
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: May file lawsuit in any court of competent jurisdiction or seek advisory opinion from Public Access Counselor

fee_structure.electronic_fee: Enhanced access fees may apply for programming or formatting
fee_structure.search_time_fee: No search or retrieval fees for standard requests
fee_structure.notes: May request advance payment of copying costs. Fees must be reasonably related to actual costs.

exemptions.description: Attorney work product and privileged communications
Records required to be kept confidential by federal law
Diaries, journals, and personal notes not prepared for public use (discretionary)
Administrative or technical information that would not be useful to the public (discretionary)
Computer programs developed by public agencies (discretionary)

appeal_process.appeal_authority: Indiana Public Access Counselor (advisory opinions only) or court
appeal_process.appeal_description: May contact Public Access Counselor for advisory opinion or file lawsuit in any court of competent jurisdiction.

penalties.criminal: Class A misdemeanor for knowingly or intentionally disclosing confidential information
penalties.civil: Attorney's fees available in some circumstances. Civil liability possible for willful violations.

requester_requirements.specific_format: No specific form required. Can be made orally or in writing. Must reasonably describe records sought.
requester_requirements.notes: No purpose requirement. No residency requirement. Any person may request.

specific_obligations: Provide written explanation if denying access, citing specific exemption
Separate and withhold only confidential portions
Provide electronic records in requested format if maintained electronically

oversight_body.name: Indiana Public Access Counselor
oversight_body.role: Issues advisory opinions, provides education and guidance. No formal enforcement authority.
oversight_body.contact_info: Office of the Governor, 200 W. Washington Street, Room 212, Indianapolis, IN 46204. Phone: (317) 234-0906. Email: pac@gov.in.gov

validation_metadata.verification_notes: Parsed from official statutory text file. Response time verified against canonical-values.json (5 business days - note statute uses 'reasonable time' standard with 7 day acknowledgment for written requests). 11 exemptions parsed from statute.
